column4: Been here 150 times. Honest. Over 30 years. Service and food is always consistent. Fine cocktails and wine. Excellent service. Moved away but always visit them
This was by far the best prime rib I‚Äôve ever had! Be sure to make reservations well in advance, this place is crazy busy.
Good, not great prime rib! Definite tourist attraction. Over priced, and average meat. Other chain steak houses have equal or better quality for half the price.

Referred by our friends to try their great prime rib! So good, great environment , amazing service. They carve the prime rib right in front of you served table side. Nice touch. Overall a great experience I would totally come back

Classic, old school prime rib joint. Basic menu prime rib, salad choice of potato and Yorkshire pudding. Get the king cut and have it seared. Waiter was great. Prime rib was excellent. When I was finished they offered me another piece. Lol. Loved it.
Celebrated our anniversary here. The food and service were excellent and they did everything possible to make it a special night.

We went for our 10th wedding anniversary. The atmosphere is superb and the place is absolutely rammed. The food is sensational and we recommend the prime rib, larger the better üòÅ You would be insane if you don't visit on any visits to San Francisco!
The prime rib was very good, but the rest of the meal was excellent. Our server, Mitra, was delightful and very attentive! My shout out for the creamed spinach - it was A-MA-ZING.
This it's a great place to go for dinner really good portion of meat everything included on the price salad cream of spinach mashed potatoes o baked potatoes

We have been going to House of Prime Rib for decades. Excellent value, although through the years, it can be very hard to get reservations. Is noisy and very hard to have an intimate dinner. Love the salad and the cart.
The service is excellent! Food is delicious!!! Everything I wanted plus more!! The drinks were good and the food and service is amazing!!!
Delicious prime rib celebration with family of 10. Wonderful, attentive waiter. Just what I hoped for.

We are Asians, small appetite but the staff happily allowed sharing and made us feel so welcome. Steak was full of flavour, very tender, price very affordable, environment though very busy was cosy and there were happy faces all round.
What can I say: If love prime rib like we do, this place is fantastic! But, if you go, be sure everyone wants that, or they will be out of luck!

Prime Rib was amazing and the service stellar. It is very loud inside of the restaurant due to it's popularity. We all commented we wish we didn't feel rushed to eat and get out. Otherwise, I highly recommend this restaurant

column3: Do not go here they trick you with 3 hour wait
column4: You arrive they tell you it‚Äôs 1‚Äì1.1/2 hours and really it‚Äôs 3 hours Service is so rude and they are deceptive about the queues The are booked 5-9.30pm Then you wait and wait and wait and then you ar seated 9.45

I am sold!!!! I am coming back next visit. Great prime rib like I remember from years gone by. Yorkshire pudding, tender meat, mashed potato and gravy were amazing. I loved the salad, and bread. Our waitress and help were excellent.
Reserved a table, arrived 10 min early, waited for 45 minutes to be seated... did not yet get a chance to rate the food. Do not get the ‚ÄúOld fashioned‚Äù or the Martini. They are terrible :(

column3: The highest quality and the best Prime Rib I‚Äôve ever had in my life! Salad and side dishes couldn‚Äôt have been better. Th
column4: The highest quality and the best Prime Rib I‚Äôve ever had in my life! Salad and side dishes couldn‚Äôt have been better. The best service!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Don‚Äôt mess around with anything but the thickest cut of prime rib. Ask for the tobacco horseradish. Spinach and baked potato are my favorite Fantasy Cake for desert Kelly is a great waitress and really takes care of her guests.

This is a traditional restaurant in San Francisco. We always recommend it to friends and family, but our last time dinner the prime rib house cut and the end cut petite was not us expected. Very tough.

column3: SO SO SO SO AMAZING - Must Visit
column4: It has been a while since I found an amazing restaurant that knows prime rib. You can't do better than House of Prime Rib and the whole atmosphere goes right along with the food.

Best Prime Rib...I had the gigantic portion...the Martini‚Äôs are amazing also...not a fan of creamed anything but the dinner was amazing! Get a rez bcuz you may not eat or be waiting for hours if you don‚Äôt. Worth it tho!!
I was here for dinner tonight with my sister and brother-in-law. I‚Äôm not a huge Prime Rib fan so I had their Chilean Sea Bass. It was delicious!

I have been eating at House of Prime Rib for years and always look forward to this place every time I travel to San Francisco. This is an old school quaint essential San Francisco establishment. The service is impeccable and the food is wonderful.

column3: Sorry guys.. I just don‚Äôt get it
column4: I‚Äôm sure this could done a whole lot better.. Perhaps it was just an off day for me but I wasn‚Äôt feeling everyone else‚Äôs experience here.. the beef at Huntsman in Dunchurch is far better... Sorry again but won‚Äôt give it a second try
Sat at the bar and received fast and friendly service. Prime rib is excellent and comes with plentiful sides. Great overall experience.
We had an amazing dinner in that place. Everything was great. The service was really friendly and the meal was lovely!

You walk in the you feel like you just went back to 1955. The drinks are ok, I had a watered down Manhatten. The food is great and the so is the staff. It's expensive but you will walk out of there VERY ful
This is absolutely the best prime beef I have ever tasted. It a a complete ceremony around prime beef, and they really know how to do so. Love this place.

A great place for a prime rib dinner. If you‚Äôre on your own - eat at the bar. Very good service. Suggest going for +1 on your ‚Äòhow do you like that cooked‚Äô as my medium came out quite rare. All good.
The meat here is very good and you get very big portions but I have had better. We were served quickly despite the place being so busy that there was a 2 hour wait to eat at the bar.
Very good restaurant. The meat is incredible. Almost imposible to eat everything. The bread is fantastic. Also very good service.
if you want to taste a good steak, this would be one of good choices. But a problem is you should make a reservation at least before a month you visit there

We had a group of 13 and were able to make same day reservations. So lucky! Had found this place on a list of the ‚ÄúTop Funnest Restaurants‚Äù in San Fran. And, indeed, it was. Simple menu but not simple ambiance. Food was delicious if...More

I'm not sure I want to write a long review simply because the only things you want to know is that if you like meat and prime rib this is the place for you. Just.Plain.Epic. The only thing I'd change if I go back is to ask for less gravy on top.

column3: No reservation? Ask to sit at the bar
column4: You will need to make a reservation well in advance and the experience is definitely better at a table but you can always sit at the bar. The cornbread isn't on the menu but if you ask for it they will bring it. The martinis are great and oh yes the prime rib isn't bad either. A great experience.

This restaurant is so old school, it should be teaching other restaurants how to do it great. We had a 7;30 reservation and were seated as soon as we came in. Service was prompt, professional and point on. Cocktails are strong, and wine by the glass is a good pore. No matter what size prime rib you order the portions are huge and the sides are also. I am fussy about my baked potatoes and when they loaded( butter, sour cream, bacon) it truly is and cooked perfectly.It's an excellent value, as the meal comes with the salad made at the table, bread, creamed Spinach, loaded potato or mashed potaoes BTW: the gentleman who handles the reservation and calls you back to confirm is very personable and a pleasure to do business with. LONG LIVE HOUSE OF PRIME RIB  Useful 1

This restaurant has been on Van Ness for years, and always appears to be booked up. Despite diet trends in dining, there still appear to be meat lovers out there who know a value when they see it. For the price of just a slab of prime rib at a specialty steakhouse, you get an excellent prime rib with a huge, tasty salad (tossed table side), Yorkshire pudding, and generous baked potato / mashed potato. Service is extremely attentive, and the carving station by your table is both entertaining and convenient. There are children‚Äôs versions of prime rib, but few other dining alternatives on the menu.

Fun service, excellent food, generous portions, The place was rather busy and somewhat loud but that did not detract from an enjoyable meal. We were a little confused about the sides and if there was an extra charge or if we had to pick one to share. They gave us everything we wanted and even more than we asked for for the included price.

I never thought I'd taste beef as good as I enjoyed in BA, until here. Carved at your table, you just pick your cut. Meal comes with tasty salad, choice of mashed or baked potato, choice of creamed corn or spinach, and Yorkshire pudding. We brought our own wine as corkage fee was low. Our group strategy was to order largest cut and take half home. It was so good, I ate the whole piece. Service was prompt not pushy from friendly wait staff. They have a vegetarian plate available. I hear you want to reserve a table in advance. I know why.
Very good restaurant. The meat is incredible. Almost imposible to eat everything. The bread is fantastic. Also very good service.

column3: Best baked potato in the world!
column4: First time trying prime rib and and was a lucky girl to try it there. The sauce on the rib was so delish and seasoned nicely also the creme spinach was so nicely cooked, but what stole the night for me was their loaded baked potato, it changed the baked potatoe game for me! Baked potato standards are RAISED and I doubt anyone can touch House of Prime rib on that one.
if you want to taste a good steak, this would be one of good choices. But a problem is you should make a reservation at least before a month you visit there
To much to big wow proper nice steak place this a little pricey but you come off street thinking its dead and its buzzing great place for special occasion
Having dined here a number of times and this last time was the last. Portions are smaller and the plates they are served on are smaller while the price climbs. Not worth the effort.

When you plan to go to a high-end steakhouse, this is what you expect. The service, the food, the simple menu. We were very impressed with this establishment. I can't wait for the next special occasion!
We had dinner here on Aug 11, we had to wait almost an hour but I can say that it deserves it. I had the house classical cut and was delicious and generous.
Very good meal, somewhat expensive. They even offered me a second slic of beef after i had finished..reservations highly suggested. We arrived without one but they seated us in about 45 minutes
A great place, outstanding meat, juicy and super delicious. A huge waiting list because the house is very famous. Service good a bit overdone...too busy The only bad point: it is so loud!
Four people for a business dinner. The food and service were top notch. It was not conducive for actually conducting business but great for entertaining customers!

column3: If you love steak! This is the place!
column4: It is very good, but my advice is booking in advance because it is very popular, very difficult for a walk-in! Menu is very simple 5 deferents size of steak and you choose or the sides! Quality is good!

column3: Could be the best meal of my life
column4: There are no words for how delicious this meal was. The mashed potatoes were creamy, the meat tender and cooked to perfection, the Yorkshire pudding soaked up all the yummy gravy....the inside was lovely and old school. The entire experience was wonderful. Just go!!!!
Really enjoyed the food. It was VERY filling so don't be an amateur and eat too much bread at the start. Service was great and the chef was accommodating to a last minute change.
Heard so much about this place, but it was ok and no more. The steak was very tender which is great, but lack of flavor.. also the desserts (crem brule & bread pudding). Not worth the money.

Obviously this is a well known establishment in San Francisco. My wife saw it on TV one time and we always wanted to go. Finally got a chance this last month. Fantastic food and experience. I would go back.

column3: Best roast beef I have tasted
column4: The best roast beef I have had in a long time and amazing salad that is prepared at your table, excellent mashed potatoes and baked potatoes with amazing fillings. I will be back here again.
The restaurant is wonderful . Tasty is very good. Steaks are delicious and salads are also amazing . I really enjoy it. The staffs are very friendly and nice.
Expect 2-3+ hours wait if don't have reservations. People willing to wait that long to have Prime Rib, that's all I need to say.
The old school ambiance and menu work really well here. The food is absolutely amazing. I see why it‚Äôs difficult to get a reservation. HOPR: don‚Äôt change a thing.

column3: I normally don‚Äôt like prime rib but
column4: This place was awesome! It was quite the experience and super delicious. It‚Äôs a lot of food that you get for your money‚Äôs worth.

column3: great and classic dinner in the city
column4: been many times but no since moving to Denver great dinner, service and the whole ball of wax..a SF must go
Terrific prime rib perfectly cooked. Good service. Reasonable cost for the area. We'll go back next time we're in the city.

The food is excellent and the atmosphere is very lush and sophisticated. Somehow the waiter seemed to have added and additional $20 to our bill (on top of what we tipped!) and that has not yet been resolved.

We visited for a friend‚Äôs birthday for a special occasion. It was only a choice of which type of cut of beef you wanted but the wait was worthwhile - an amazing meal with amazing service. Highly recommended for anyone nearby!
We expected fine dining.What we got was average food with a bunch of kids in t shirts and shorts.Noisy and obnoxious.So glad we didn‚Äôt bring quests we would have been so embarrassed.

column3: Best Prime Rib Ever! (Not for vegetarians)
column4: You definitely need a reservation if you want to eat at a decent time. The prime rib was amazing and I don't even like prime rib! The sour dough bread is also delicious! All the sides are great and highly recommend the horseradish sauce.

Hands down, THE BEST prime rib! The food and service were impeccable! Go there hungry because the servings are plentiful. And the table-side service was a treat. Definitely on the list for our next trip to SF.

Very busy bustling place full of energy that has Great food, Great service. The only negative is that they ran out of red wine glasses last night and we drank a great wine in Chardonnay glasses. The best prime rib I have every had !

column3: The name says all, but I'll say, "Its awesome!"
column4: Classy yet relaxing atmosphere, professional and friendly staff, cold drinks...and of course the fabulous PRIME RIB (and other great grub)! My wife and I both enjoyed this, though I may have eaten a bit more than she did. ;) ENJOY!

The food was excellent! More important was the customer service. The people were very welcoming and enjoyable. Make reservations is better than dropping in but if you do drop in do it early. Better chance of eating early
Don't ever miss prime ribs here if you are meat lover, visiting SF. The queue is worth waiting for, our queue is 1hr waited but eventually only took us 30mins waited. I definitely visit again!!

When my wife and I get that urge for prime rib, we head to House of Prime Rib, the best. The salad, baked potato, and spinach adders top it off. GM Evan Burns does a great job as he done for over 10 years.
Had a great meal here food was first class and good service , friendly service and the steak was to die for well worth booking

House of Prime Rib has the best prime rib anywhere. I compare every prime rib meal and no others measure up. You have to plan ahead and get a reservation but they will take some walk-ins but you need to go early.

column3: Fantastic prime rob cooked to perfection!
column4: Had dinner with our daughter and her boyfriend here. The food and service were amazing! Reservations book up quickly so plan ahead!
They squeeze you like sardines! The tables are so packed together that one can hardly walk between them. The quality of the prime rib is just so so. It a very mass production show.
This Restaurant servers are great,,, ALWAYS lots of customers ... Very good Baked potatoes and cream of Spinach.

This restaurant serves various cuts of prime rib with excellent sides. Between the salad, potato, and creamed spinach, you will not walk out hungry! Not a prime rib person, but this was great. Nice atmosphere with top of the line service.
This place is great, I have been here many times. Mainly cos they serve and amazing Roast beef, with a delicious side of baked potatoes. Pure comfort food cooked to perfection.

Fantastic no other words necessary other than the Yorkshire puds! Chef don't open the oven while they're cooking otherwise they go flat like ours! Other than that just brilliant. Worth the trip to SFO.

column3: We ate like a famine was coming tomorrow ...
column4: The absolute best prime rib in town!!! Great people , exceptional service , it's hard to beat that package ! We came here hungry and left stuffed and satisfied!
.....who could ask for anything more 'ONE MENU CHOICE' its prime rib all the time and I don't mind at all. I can truly say that this was one of my favorite restaurants of all times.
great food large cuts of prime rib with baked potato or mashed. Yorkshire pudding and spinach as sides... almost forgot about the salad!
We were very close to the next couple. It was so loud that it was difficult to carry on a conversation. Food was better than average, but not worth the price.

Location: Nob Hill Parking: metered, paid street parking Atmosphere: traditional, warm, elegant Staff: incredibly accommodating Menu: limited to a fairly fixed menu Drinks: standard Meal: unbelievable - try it Prices: pricy Visit Again: please! Recommend To Friends: you bet

column3: Loud restaurant with lots of food
column4: Very loud, touristic restaurant with lots of big tables and long lines. Good meat and sauce but not worth the price. Expensive but dishes are big even for US standards
A n old standby that still delivers a lot of meat for your dollar. Old time service and tasty sides like creamed spinach
Arrived from the UK and this was the first restaurant we eat in top notch food and service and you will not find a better steak anywhere else an absolute must to visit.
An excellent place for Prime Rib. Ate at the bar with 2 other family members. It was worth the wait. Delicious food and great service, once seated.

column3: Get reservations for the prime rib of your life!
column4: I've been to lots of different steakhouses and this rivals them all for the best of the best! Everything you order here is high quality and prepared perfectly! If you have the chance, do not miss it!
They do Prime Rib right as the name describes. Finish your house cut and get another slice. Accompanied by salad, creamed spinach, bread, sometimes cornbread. For around $50, it's a deal!
Have wanted to try this for a few years but not got around to it before now. Service, surrounding all 5 starts and the food deserves 6 stars !!
The food was amazing, and great service. Definitely recommend this place. The price was good for the great meal you get.
The service was excellent. The prime rib was cooked to perfection. The dinner comes with salad, cream spinach potatoes, Yorkshire pudding. You will be taking a doggie bag home. You need reservations.
Great Service. Great food. The menu is carnivore's perfection. The service had a personal touch. If you're in this area I recommend it
The House of Prime Rib has the best Prime Rib. Served table side and with all the side dishes. A great piece of San Francisco history.
I don't normally choose Prime Rib, but this it place to make an exception. The meat is perfect, with all the Au jus you want. It's a once in a lifetime meal.
This place has one of the prime ribs! Good service, although reservations are hard to get because of their popularity, it is well worth the wait! Love ‚ù§Ô∏è this resto!
Terrific restaurant for having only one dish but with 3 choices on how to have it cut. Keep your expectations up because flavoursare unique. The only comment I would do is that they don't have wifi.
Loved it the food was excellent. The wait time was 2 minutes. I prime rib was tender and juicy, the mashed potato and cream spinach was delicious. Would differently go back
Great service, prime rib cooked and cut to order, price for prime rib includes sides. Dining experience comfortable and not rushed. Friends highly recommend this restaurant

It was our first time and we were so impressed with the service and the quality and taste of everything specially the Prime Rib. It melts in your mouth. I have never had anything like this. We will definitely come back. Great job!!'

We had dinner with our family and close friends. The service was excellent and the food absolutely delicious! The prime rib is perfect accompanied by salad, potato, Yorkshire pudding and spinach. I highly recommend dining here. It is an experience not to be missed!
It has been a few years since I ate and when I did it was very good and I enjoyed the prime rib I would totally recommend this place to anybody

To say they feed you is an understatement. Standard meal gives you enough for 2 days for an average size guy. Prime ribs are large and prepped right at your table. Not to mention the nice size portioned sides. Two thumbs up on the meal.
Delicious food! It was very loud though and difficult to have conversation. Make a reservation and bring your appetite. We will eat here again!
Perfect meat, tender and juicy. You must order medium or well done, if you don't want to eat it very red. The side orders are very yummy. The mashed potatoes are delicious.

Even after all these years, their roast beef is still roasted and cut to perfection, exactly to what you requested. The side dishes are large and well prepared. You always come away very satisfied and too full, and happy with the bill.

This is how prime rib should be served! Prepared in rock salt and served tableside! Portions are generous, servers are attentive! It's all in the presentation! You'll certainly enjoy this absolutely phenomenal dining experience!
You have never had prime rib like this. Cut off the whole rib table side, it is the juiciest you ever ate. The spinach, corn, and salad are all included. Great value for a great meal.
Excellent service and great prime rib. Simple menu is welcomed, you know you are having prime rib. I enjoyed the salad made at your table.

column3: The only place for Prime Rib
column4: Best Prime Rib place in the Bay Area, maybe even in the USA. Always superb in taste and tenderness. Outstanding and friendly service.

column3: A wait, delicious food and no lingering
column4: Either call ahead or be prepared for about 45-60 min wait. The food is delicious with huge portions and moderately priced. If you enjoy a lovely grilled piece of prime rib... Stop! Look no further... It's here.
This was the high light of my San Fran eating experience. The meat selection is outstanding, and the quality is superb. I highly recommend treating yourself to this spot.
Excellent food, reasonable price! You can get any cut of prime rib from a petite cut to the King Henry cut with bone. Salad, bake potato and side dish is included. Excellent value!
texas size food over here! great experience, wonderful food, large servings. its pricey but worth it!
The steaks are juicy and tender, and amazingly we can ask for more for free! The only drawback is it is too crowded at times.

This place has a limited menu and focusses on, as the name suggests, prime rib. But boy do they do it well. The beef is cooked as requested and is very tender and tasty. Really enjoyed the meal and it is decent value too.
Love it. Start with a gin martini and salad. Don't fill up on the bread. Get the King cut, baked potato, creamed spinach, and a big cabernet. Go with a date or a big group, it works for any occasion.

I have been to this restaurant a few times and the food and service has always been consitently good. This is not mind blowingly good but its definitely great food when you're feeling carnivorous in San Francisco.
Slip the ma√Ætre d a few bucks to get a seat if you aren't on the list. Food was delicious, service was excellent - one of my favorites in San Fran.
very very loud place , i wont go there for a date food was very very average , the steak are looking awesome but taste not too good
Get ear plugs with you . You'll need that. The acoustic of ambience is very bad. You can hear all noise around your table!!!

We were extremely satisfied with our visit here. Service matched up to the quality of the food. Portions were big for us but it was so nice we finished the lot and worried about the over indulgence after! Highly recommend to anybody, for any occasion.
Big, Delicious and succulent Prime Rib, the salad and the bread were good too and the ambiance was enjoyable.
This place is a must for meat lovers coming through SF. Its great. I promise. Went here for dinner with friends, and we all left stuffed and satisfied. Also, the lemon drop drink is delicious.
I've had good prime rib before but nothing compared to this one. Everything was perfect, including the cheesecake I had for dessert. Yes, it's rather pricey, but unforgettable.

column3: Could not eat the whole thing
column4: A great old steakhouse not in the Midwest. Best prime rib ever..if you love prime rib this is the place to go. Went with my daughter , her boyfriend and hubby. Had great food and service. Will go back again.
The name says it all. Prime rib to die for. I eat here all the time and will continue to do so as long as they have the best prime rib.
Best prime rib eve! Great salad as well! If you love prime rib there is none better then the House of Prime Rib. Tough to get a reservation, but they do take walking, but go early and enjoy!
in.you.go..heres.your.meat.thanks..get.out...realy..just.a.factory.good.meat..nothing.to.scream.on..just.a.factory
Long established and still standing for good reason! It truly has the best prime rib and excellent service. You will need to reserve about a month in advance.
It's a tradition of mine to come here every December with friends. The food is fantastic, service is great, and the atmosphere is warm and spirited. We will be back next year.
The House of Prime Rib is a long time staple of San Francisco. Their steaks are excellent. You will not be disappointed.
Couldn't wait to take our friends here, and the HOPR did not disappoint. Our 3rd time here and expectations were once again exceeded. They are the most consistent restaurant ever.

column3: When you only do ONE thing you better do it Right ~ this place does it!
column4: You must get a reservation to eat here. If you have someone in your group who does not eat Beef ~ they can order a Veggie plate. One of the best Prime Rib dinners I have had.
Well the food was okay, but a very special type of preperation of the meat. But great place and a experince.
I went there after a long time. It was good as always. Some things never change. I reccomend it with no hesitation.
My husband and I ate here during our first visit to San Francisco in celebration of our anniversary. The food and service were excellent. I recommend splurging on this restaurant at least once.

The BEST prime rib!!! temperature was perfect. you did not need a knife to cut through the tender steak. we went for a birthday celebration dinner and everyone was very helpful to make it a memorable experience.

column3: A perfect place for Dad's birthday
column4: Went there for a special occasion with the entire family and had a wonderful time. The prime rib is delicious, the sides are very good and the cocktails are the best!

Could not believe the quality of food with such a moderate price! Order the spinach in garlic and oil instead of the creamed spinach!! Amazing!! Service, quality and quantity. They truly outdid themselves. Great bar, too.

column3: The Best Prime Rib in the West
column4: A definite must go for hardcore prime rib connoisseurs. Zeppelin transported and cut to perfection in plate of au jus than never runs out. Advance reservations is a must if you want to eat at a decent time due to its popularity.

column3: still one of the best prime ribs to be had.
column4: Came in on a early dinner at 5:30, hard to reserve, but worth it, the ribs was perfect. and today i got a peice with a large cab on it. envirment was engergetic and the prime ribs is just so nice!
This restaurant serves one thing and does it right. You must love prime rib but it could be the best prime rib you have ever had! Service is excellent. Loved everything from start to finish.

column3: Don't miss.....worth a trip...just to eat here
column4: From the initial contact with the truly professional waiters, to the sequenced progression of the house speciality.....everything done to true perfection. Having eaten all over the world this is special restaurant.

Atmosphere, food, and wait staff are all top notch! Prime rib was incredible. Bread, salad, spinach and bake potato delicious! Waiter was very knowledgeable and presentation of food was terrific. Yorkshire pudding that came with the meal was also delicious!! Highly recommend.
Anthony Bourdain was right. House of Prime Rib is the best. Retro sans kitsch environment. Best quality meat you could hope for. They do one thing and they do it right. Sides are fabulous.
Crowded, loud, and unnecessarily spicy spinach. The meat is good, specially if you like juice on it.
The best steak ever. We ordered well done king steak for two of course and it was a lot but really really good. Of course is expensive but worth it. They don't have sangria :( I love this place :)

column3: Best Place to go for Prime Rib
column4: I have been going here for many years and it never disappoints. The Prime Rib is great. Service is great. Nothing at all to complain about
Visited my old home in SF after 40 years away. House of Prime rib was just as wonderful as the old days. Fabulous food and service.
excellent if you love prime rib. not much more to eat. Very crowded and noisey. The service was prompt and very good. Many extra's included in the price

From the well prepared (and large) cocktails, to the salad prepared table side, to the beyond-delicious prime rib, to the friendly and efficient wait staff, this place exudes excellence and tradition! A must-do when in SF.

Had a great experience here with my husband, daughter (5 at the time) and in-laws. The food was great, and service was excellent. The waitress was so good to my daughter that my daughter talked about her for the rest of the trip. Great experience!
Food was expensive but really delicious. Would have given it five stars but it was so noisy and crowded, I was practically sitting with the next table.

Prime Rib here is really great, glad I waited to eat at 10 pm. Even then it was still crowded. It was a very happy and lively atmosphere. I highly recommend calling ahead and get a reservation. A bit cramp crowded.
Just the best prime rib you will ever taste. Service is excellent too. If you are a vegetarian steer well clear, however if you like your meat melt in the mouth then book up !!
Absolutely amazing prime rib. You have a choice of 4 cuts and then baked or mashed potato. That's all you have to make for decisions and you will be satisfied. Definitely worth the price tag.

If you love Prime Rib.. then this is a must place to visit when you are in the City. It a decadent old resturant that serves a great portion of prime rib with the usual side dishes. typical of a great prime rib establishment...
We thoroughly enjoyed the preparation and flourish involved in selecting the cuts and the creation of the salad. It was the best creamed spinach ever as well.
If you're a Lawry's fan, you'll find this place fits that mold. Our meal was great, and they were very accomodating about our separate check needs.
Great Prime Rib Dinner. Its can get loud and if you dont have a reservation, the wait can be long; but, if Its meat that you want; this is the place.

This is an experience in itself. My husband and I were recommended to try this restaurant and, if you're a carnivore, it does't disappoint. Well worth a visit if you're in San Francisco. A note of warning - the serves are HUGE (for us Australians).
Very lucky that I live close by to this restaurant, spending our special occasion or just to make tummy great the best .
Perfectly cooked for varying tastes. Medium rare for US guests, medium to well for UK! Good service. Booking essential. Would be fine dining with better dress code.

column3: Fantastic food. Best prime rib I've ever had.
column4: Best prime rib I've ever had. Every side dish is wonderful too. Great staff. Old-time feel. The place is pretty noisy, but that kind of adds to the fun.
I never had prime rib until I ate at The House of Prime Rib. Thanks to them I fell in love with prime rib. Amazing.

Our expectations were high given it's ratings Service was fantastic Food whilst great quality was not for everyone but can't fault the size of helpings!! If you are looking for expansive menu then probably not for you
Step back in time here, great food, carving stations, excellent prime rib and sides. Although Yorkshire pudding is well touted, I guess its an acquired taste. Very well known and popular place!

HoPR offers amazing prime rib, great sides, and great drinks. Service is friendly, and the "all-in" pricing is a bargain. We had a 90-minute wait for a table on a Tuesday--fortunately Gina the bartender and Aaron the waiter made the time fly.
I had read the reviews and was all set for a big night at the House of Prime a Rib in San Francisco. The place was packed and we felt rushed by the waiter.
A little late with this review. Nice old restaurant with good food. The service was really good too! So much food, I think everyone had enough for lunch the next day!
Went with 2 friends who had already been here before and both spoke highly about this restaurant and I was not disappointed. Incredible food and good value.
Something to experience if you are ever in San Francisco. Great food , Great service. Not many choices which is perfect for me.

obviously delicious prime rib. But they do it so well. Salad made at the table, many people attending your every need with the waiter in charge. Everything is done right. Very friendly staff and upbeat dining rooms and the bar area is very nice.
Loved everything, Prime Rib was delicious! Had reservations, didn't have to wait too long. Drinks was great

We went to House Of Prime Rib for our second time this weekend. The food and service were both amazing. Going here is more than just a meal it's an experience. We will be back next time our plans take us to San Francisco.
Prime rib rare at the bar with a vodka Martini. Great food, excellent service and a horse radish that will clear your sinuses of you don't watch out. Would recommend and return.

column3: If Jesus were alive he would eat here!!
column4: Fantastic meal! A real treat with the biggest, tastiest, gut bustingest baked potato known to man. Would love to go again if it wasn't 9,000km away.

Had a really amazing evening here...a really simple but effective menu concept. Service excellent. Food incredible, one of the best steaks we have had! Great wine list. Atmosphere was really good too. Recommend reserving a table.

The professionalism and presentation was spot-on! The food was delicious and the staff was friendly. Im glad i didn't over indulge cause i had plenty of food...Also a great place for a Vodka Martini-Extra dirty-YUM!!...definitely will be eaten here again.
House of prime ribs is always go crowded. The atmosphere is festive. Great generous portion of food for the price. Make sure you make reservation well ahead. Parking can be challenging.
Despite the slow service, the evening turned out good experience of being out. The food was excellent.
This place was incredible!! From the delicious food to the great service, even the overall feel of the place was terrific. I cant wait to go back!
Style, service, ambiance, fabulous prime rib and creamed spinach...the best of its type in the City.!

This is an old style English Rotisserie. The Prime Rib is cut to order at the table and all of the aspects are perfect. The atmosphere, the accompanying dishes, even the coffee is great. A must for the beefeater.

Wow, that prime rib! Excellent! Gravy also really tasteful! Side dishes are actually kinda bad, except for the mashed potato which was actually really nice. But hey, you're here for the prime rib, forget the rest!
This place was not just a meal - it was an experience! Easily the best steak I've ever eaten and the service was outstanding. Very highly recommended.
I wouldn't pass on this restaurant unless I didn't like beef. The service is great, the food is even better, and the prices are good also, The ultimate prime rib with an iconic San Francisco Gem.

Have been coming here for years.....and never a disappointment! The wait staff and prime rib is second to none. I always walk out of the place a fat rat. Kudos to Sarah for your attentiveness and service on my most recent visit.
Everything we ordered was perfect ! This is definitely the best restaurant ever ! We travel a lot and never had good this good. You can cut the steak with a fork. The Service is Great!!

Celebrated my 30th wedding anniversary. Shariff, our waiter was the best. Ordered St. Francis Zinfandel which was wonderful for only $36. The prime rib was one of the best I've tasted. Great experience but be ready to pay. Worth it for an anniversary celebration.
This restaurant is a iconic location in San Francisco. Prior to this trip last visit here was over 20 years ago and quality, service and ambiance has only gotten better.
If you like Prime Rib, this is the place for you Great food, dinner, atmosphere and very very good service!!!
One of the best steaks I've ever had. Great service, booked this table months in advance. It was packed at 6pm so bums on seats speaks volumes. Would defo recommend this place to anyone
Probably one of the nicest places to eat in the city, beautiful food and couldn't get nicer staff. Will be returning on future visits to the city.

we spent our last night in san fran at this restaurant. superb old fashioned service,excellent bar. food amazing,simple menu but what they do,they do extremely well. tasty tender prime rib and great sides. place buzzing and rightly so. high recommended go!!!!!!!!!
//The meal was so good that words can't explain it sufficiently. You need a reservation and call early as they are alway real busy.

We ate here on our last night and was not disappointed. We had a small booth for 2. It was fairly strange all the pomp and ceremony just to serve a salad, but I guess that's there thing. Food was lovely and great big portions.
yes, we had to go up to SF for the best prime rib, outside of Texas. Definitely get reservations for Friday night and be open to eating at last seating. Service is excellent.

We ate here and the food was very good but, my husband and I both had food poisoning that night. There are lots of servers dealing with you and bringing you different things so there is ample opportunity for illnesses to be passed.
Absolutely amazing meal. The prime rib was cooked perfectly the baked potato was amazing everything from the service to the wine absolutely first class. Can't say enough about it!!!!!
Just as good as it was in 1966! Same maitre'd! Now he is gray! Keep up the good work! This was a great way to celebrate our 50th anniversary!

column3: I'm drooling as I write this.
column4: I had lived in SF for three years, and I had never been to the House of Prime Rib. The place is off the chain for beef lovers! Excellent food, excellent service! Make a reservation way in advance this place books up!

My girlfriend and I have monthly dates here and ALWAYS finish our plates and get seconds. HOPR is an SF staple and you HAVE to get there. I get the English cut (thinly sliced) with mashed, and half spinach half corn. Amazing!

column3: A great place. Old world charm in a comfortable atmosphere...
column4: Our waitress was the best ever!! She made the whole experience even better..personable and attentive.
Best Prime Rib I ever ate, We'll worth the money. The waiter was great and very helpful.great birthday dinner while on vacation in San Francisco.

To be fair....the prime rib was great....the waiter was full of personality.....the service......horrible! Our waiter kept offering apologies for the delay in service....maybe just too many people. But, hey.....there's basically one menu item. We've been coming here for seven years.....this year was the worst. Disappointed.....

column3: Melt in your Mouth Rib, Attentive Service...can't wait to go back!
column4: Had the best dinner here!! Service was spot on, even the horseradish sauce was to die for...and the extra piece for eating my meal did NOT go to waste!! Worth every penny!

column3: Only place for prime rib in SF
column4: It's crowded, noisy, doesn't help to have a reservation, but once you get seated and the cart comes, it's all forgotten. Yes, you can have seconds, but to do so you would probably need to unbutton your pants!

This restaurant is an annual tradition for our family. It is so delicious -- the prime rib, fully loaded baked potato, salad, yorkshire pudding, creamed spinach/corn... IT'S TOO GOOD TO DESCRIBE! The service is impeccable, the atmosphere is good, and the food is second-to-none. AMAZING!
By far the best food that I have ever had!! The service was wonderful and the prime rib was succulent! I suggest to come on an empty stomach because you will definitely leave feeling satisfied!!

I went here when visiting San Francisco for a friend's birthday & it was absolutely amazing!! Everything from the salad to the prime rib & sides, such an excellent meal. I will make sure & eat here every trip to San Francisco!

Reservations suggested. 4-5 Star depending on your taste. We found it outstanding in terms of service and the table side prime rib cutting is a nice touch. Nice wine list. Parking can be tough but heck it's SF. Will visit again when in SF.
This place has the perfect prime meat. If you can finish your meat and you can ask for more and is free. excellent gravy. But making a reservation is very difficult.
Excellent prime rib! Superb service. But it's a tad expensive. Our bill averaged out to around $50 per person.
The prime rib is great! I think you get a good deal for the price. It does get crowded, too crowded on the weekends, but worth it. I would however avoid going during holiday seasons.

I think this restaurant is about a 8 or 9 out of ten. Food was good not bad. They need to spend more money on the seating fabric and update it, possibly to a burgundy leather to give it a more luxurious feel.

Service was simple and great...nothing showy, they get to the point and your food is served fairly quickly. Portions are great for the price. I enjoyed the sides but didn't focus on them as the prime rib was extremely juicy and cooked perfectly. A must!
The food is amazing the service is 4 stars ! You will need a reservation but for a good reason!!! Best Prime Rib i have ever ate in my life ! The salad and home made bread is amazing as well!!!!

column3: The Best of the Best Prime Rib
column4: Excellent service and food, elegant dining. The roast beef here is the best and leanest. It is a limited menu with one seafood selection. We come here whenever we are in town. You need to make a reservation at least a month in advance.

A total go to in San Francisco. Try to make a reservation, or you can walk in but prepare to wait a bit. Huge portions, simple menu of prime rib, because that is their specialty! Don't serve what you can't master! That's my motto!
Absolutely hands down a fabulous experience!! Go with the baked potato and get the works!! An amazing dining experience--Go tonight!

The service was excellent, the portions were big and the quality was very good. Very accommodating. I requested the spinach saut√©ed with garlic instead of creamed spinach. Not a problem. Do reserve with time.

column3: Best prime rib anywhere in SF
column4: I can't find a single negative with this restaurant. Where else can you go and get a generous slice of prime rib and all sides including their speciality salad for 40.00! It is best to make a reservation in advance.

column3: Pricy but she is worth it
column4: Great food, superior service, and lively atmosphere. You won't be disappointed. You need to make reservations. If you are a cable car traveler, need to take Hyde route and be prepared to walk up hills after dinner. Otherwise cab is best.

The prime ribs here are the best! Tender, juicy and perfectly done, the salad, Yorkshire pudding and other accompaniments are also great. I especially love the convivial atmosphere and good service. A must-try when in the city! Will definitely return when I'm in town.
If you like Prime Rib you will find none better than this 60 year old establishment. If you leave Hungry it is your fault.

column3: A must try when in San Francisco
column4: I knew it would be great but it was actually better than what I expected. The most tender and melt-in-your mouth prime rib I've ever had was from this restaurant. Memorable and I would definitely try again.

Even though we had a 45 minute wait (with reso) this reataurant is probably the most efficient operation I have ever seen. By the time you sit down, bread is on your table in two minutes and beef in your mouth within 7 min.

Wonderful, professional staff, excellent food. You can walk there from Castle Inn. The dining atmoshphere was worth the experience...white table cloths, fresh flowers on the table, with dim lighting, very romantic.

column3: A must try when in San Francisco
column4: I knew it would be great but it was actually better than what I expected. The most tender and melt-in-your mouth prime rib I've ever had was from this restaurant. Memorable and I would definitely try again.

My experience of this place was somewhat tainted because it was our first night in SF and we were completely exhausted from a very long trip from the UK. However, I am confident that I would post the same review if I was to visit...More

Even though we had a 45 minute wait (with reso) this reataurant is probably the most efficient operation I have ever seen. By the time you sit down, bread is on your table in two minutes and beef in your mouth within 7 min.

column3: Some good, some okay, some not-so-good...
column4: Good (but not great) prime rib. It had better be, since that's pretty much all that they serve. Their preparation lacked the highly flavored and somewhat crispy "lip" that true beef lovers appreciate. But it tasted good and was obviously slow cooked with care. Mashed potatoes tasted pretty good, but were the consistency of soup. They were served with a brown gravy that wasn't awful, but had a commercial taste to it. The Yorkshire pudding was outstanding...better than any I have had, even better than in England. The creamed spinach was just NASTY tasting. How do you ruin creamed spinach? Easy...just load it up with nutmeg...NUTMEG?...really? Awful-awful-awful. Salad dressing (only one type available) was okay, but the salad itself contains watercress and pimento. We tried to order it without these ingredients, but we were told that we could not. We didn't like it very much. Terrific warm individual loaf of VERY fresh, crusty sourdough bread on the table. Out-of-this-world creme brulee for dessert. The service was excellent and very professional. I'm glad we went, but I wouldn't go back. For these high prices I expect more.

Went to celebrate a birthday and it lived up to the hype. Prime rib was so juicy and tender and the sides were very good as well. Baked potato was HUGE and salad, creamed spinach, and yorkshire pudding were very tasty. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.

Place's packed....advanced booking is advisable.Only prime rib is served - who needs anything else??- huge portions of nice and juicy meat.Side dishes: salads,spinach cream are bottomless...Tasty gravy and potato pure√© as well.NIce people,great attention overall.If you don't get a reservation, go and wait at the bar...nice beers and wine selections,and really well-made drinks.Enjoy!

Lovely old bar and restaurant we had to wait for a table we hadn't booked this place was busy and you can see why! Service was excellent beer and cocktails were very good. We were given warm crusty bread with butter while we waited for our meal then our salad came in a large iced dish that our server tossed at the table and dressed for us it was mouth watering. Our prime steaks were melt in the mouth cooked to perfection, My husband had mash and creamed spinach with his and I had a jacket potato served and dressed with the toppings at the table. The whole evening at this restaurant was perfect, meal, service everything. Where we sat was very noisy there was a large party in the same area as us but it didn't spoil our evening. Im sure if we had asked for a quiet area we would have been moved. A little expensive but well worth it, a wonderful end to a great holiday.

I have been to House of Prime Rib several times now. For me going out to dinner should be a multifaceted experience encompassing the food, service, atmosphere and fun factor. The first time I went I overdid it on the great warm sourdough and salad to start. Never again! I always want to be sure I have room for every last morsel of the excellent prime rib. The prime rib is cut and served to order at the table. I usually order the Baked potato as a side. This is a gigantic baked potato. As soon as our server loads it up with every imaginable topping I have them wrap it to go and it is my dinner the following night. One of the bonus features of this restaurant is the valet parking as finding a parking space in that area of San Francisco requires divine intervention. There is one small drawback and I almost don't want to mention it but if you are looking for a quiet subdued place this should not be your first choice. However, if you like a boisterous atmosphere with a lot of people having a great time, this is it.

Wonderful, professional staff, excellent food. You can walk there from Castle Inn. The dining atmoshphere was worth the experience...white table cloths, fresh flowers on the table, with dim lighting, very romantic.

Anywhere else again! Had dinner with my husband and friends. Started by bringing us a loaf of hot sourdough bread...it was sooo yummy! All had various versions of prime rib, and one salmon. The prime rib was tender, juicy, and flavorful. Mashed potatoes, cream corn, and cream spinach were so good too. Honestly, we ate nothing that wasn't just delicious. A can't-miss!

We went for our 25th anniversary and it was amazing. The food was wonderful, our waiter Trevor was super and the atmosphere was great. If we ever get back to San Francisco, which I hope we do, we will definitely go back!!!
Been coming so many years and it doesn't disappoint from the great prime rib to the bread pudding. If you want a little extra just ask they will give you seconds upon request!

column3: Just; THE BEST PRIME RIB PERIOD
column4: From the moment you sit down; The food/service/drinks are top tier. They serve the best Prime rib I have ever had. Plus the salad tossed at the table, pop overs, cocktails are the best. Just the BEST

Went to the restaurant with a group of friends and had a great meal. The roast beef was perfectly cooked. The wait person really made our experience more special. She was very accommodating to all our needs and even took a picture of us which...More

We were well looked after, all the way from cocktails while we waited for the group to assemble, to being given more than we ordered to take away after the meal.  The beef was succulent and tasty, the trimmings complemented well. Memorable were the three strengths of horseradish sauce!  Tip: Get that table booked in advance.

first, let me preface this by saying that I live in Texas and am definately a beef eater. this was not the best piece of prime I have ever had before. there were 6 of us celebrating my birthday, and we had a great time. we had reservations, and were seated immediately as sonn as all were in the restaurant, and as one of my buds had brought a cake, that also was immediately taken care of. my issue was the inconsistencies of the served pieces of prime. admittedly, the roast is handcut, but my slice was definately not the same size of the slice next to me, and we ordered the same cut. disappointing. on the upside, the wine list is very moderately priced, and our service was excellent. I just hate to go to any restaurant and still be hungry after the meal

We went for our 25th anniversary and it was amazing. The food was wonderful, our waiter Trevor was super and the atmosphere was great. If we ever get back to San Francisco, which I hope we do, we will definitely go back!!!

Had a tour driver recommend this place and was grateful. Great service, excellent food carved at your table. Not a lot of menu variety, its prime rib in many forms or fish. Salad is tossed at your table. Choice of 2 sides, creamed spinach (with bacon) or creamed corn, both equal. Mashed or baked potato and of course yorkshire pudding to sop up alll the au jus. Would say you should experience it but you get a lot of food. Since we were staying at a hotel with no refrigerator so gave it to a VERY grateful homeless person, its there or in the restaurants trash.

and only primerib! THis is the place to go. It is remeniscent of a bygone era. Beef, potatoes, cocktails oh and a salad. Very retro so we blended in by ordering 2 manhattens. Haven't done that in a long time and it was excellent. The prime rib is cut to order (and size). We skipped the largest cut King Henry VIII for the smaller version. I had baked, my wife tried the mashed and we enjoyed the salad. My wie loved the veggies and I gave her mine (not a veggie person) The atmosphere was nice, casual and what I expected. Overall we had a good meal, a tad expensive but heck it's San Fransisco.
Been coming so many years and it doesn't disappoint from the great prime rib to the bread pudding. If you want a little extra just ask they will give you seconds upon request!

column3: Just; THE BEST PRIME RIB PERIOD
column4: From the moment you sit down; The food/service/drinks are top tier. They serve the best Prime rib I have ever had. Plus the salad tossed at the table, pop overs, cocktails are the best. Just the BEST

column3: The place to go if you like prime rib
column4: Very good and resonablly priced for a top end restaurant., I am a steak guy so prime is not my top choice but its all you can get here and it was very good. Nice salad and potaoe, plenty of food. Upscale bar, nice but kind of loud. Very good team service.

column3: It's Better than Average in Some Respects
column4: This restaurant enjoys the reputation of being the best Steak House in 'Frisco. I would acknowledge some of what it does is very good, but it's a mixed bag. The valet service for cars on arrival for $9 is fine as it's a busy part of town. The bar you can use on arrival is well serviced and we were ahead of our reservation time by 10 mins. The cocktails we ordered both different Martinis were great and brought to the table as we'e been moved on.The waiter was friendly and advised me about a good Napa red which I only wanted a glass or two of, not a bottle. The pre-attendance publicity had suggested that the meat was brought to your table and sliced to your direction and then cooked...inaccurate. There's what looks like a combined very miniature Airstream caravan and a Webber barbecue attended to by a chef who cuts fromm pre-cooked ribs of beef...not steak quite as I know it. I've eaten across the 'States and I've seen steaks that hang eithetr side of even large plates and I've also seen rare steak a vetenarian could have brought back to life! Their biggest steak was described as a King Henry V111 cut, it was bigger than the next cut down only because it included the bone, but was $8 dollars dearer...why, as there's no more meat involved? The starters were complimentary i.e. a medium sized Caesar salad which we hadn't ordered. It served/prepped at the table in a larger metal bowl spinning on an ice bed, which looks spectacular, but the salad dressing is very ordinary...The bread a small sour dough loaf was excellent.The accompaniments with the steak are mashed pots or Jacket with corn on the cob or spinach. The mash was passable...yes you can have tasty, creamy mash, but not necessarily here. Both the mash and spinach come off the 'Webber and weren't especially mad hot either! The jacket was served with a filling which I thought was pretty good. The steaks were very, very tender up there with the best, but I still argue as they were promoting size as well, that was a shortcoming. We opted out of desserts and had coffee...only warm not hot,again why? The bill was $250 for three people, two glasses of wine (not a bottle),two cocktails and a soft drink, no desserts...I reckon it would have had to have been a lot better to warrant that. It was goodish mostly, but not fantastic. The other info. suggested VERY smart casual dress, sorry it was casual and a a little bit smart here and there, not that it matters only by way of advice and misinformation beforehand. If I'm back in 'Frisco I wouldn't rush to return, but if you've money to burn go for it.

We all thoroughly enjoyed our meals here. The prime rib was excellent and one of the highlights of DH's visit to the city :-)This place was bustling at 730 on a Tues night, so make reservations! Easy taxi ride from Union Square.
Had a group of 20 and the food was amazing. I try to stay away from RED meat but what the heck , its quality.
A tradition in San Francisco, we decided try this landmark. It did not disappoint. Fantastic bar, great service and terrific food. Easily a top five restaurant for this beautiful city.

column3: Best Prime Rib I've ever had!
column4: Service was above average but not spectacular. But to be honest, with how awesome the Prime Rib was, they could have flipped me off, thrown the meat at me, and I still would have loved it!!!! Must go!
Best prime rib dinners around, go there everytime in town The salad is so good I could make a meal on that alone but the meat is also special and cooked to perfection.

column3: Great Place to Eat before seeing the SF Symphony
column4: Excellent Prime Rib, great ambience. Just don't park your car in the wrong place or it could be towed when you leave the restaurant.

column3: Best way to spend your money
column4: Not taking the high price into consideration, this is the best place in the San Francisco Bay area. If you are a vegetarian, I would recommend passing on this place. Order the largest piece on the menu. You won't regret it. Yum, Yum.
We live 2 hours away and eat here frequently because it is sooo good and a great value. The meal is always consistent, which is good. Great food, great service and fabulous martini's.
It's really more about the experience and atmosphere. The Prime Rib was very good indeed and the service is excellent. It's one of those places recommended by a TV Show and is worth the experience.
If you like prime rib it is the place for you. Excellent food as long as you avoid anything resembling a veggie. It's all about the beef

column3: If you haven't been here, you have to go!
column4: This is a SF staple. The waiters are wonderful, entertaining and attentive. The prime rib is good, but what you go here is for the experience and the atmosphere.
The food was just ok, service was great, wines were expensive, atmosphere was nice. I'm not a big Prime Rib person, it was very busy, must be popular, but I would not go back

I love the food, the service, the atmosphere. One of the must visit landmarks of San Francisco. They bring around a cart to carve your meat at your table. We went for a wedding anniversary. It's the perfect place for a celebration.
The House of Prime Rib is always EXCELLENT. If you love prime rib, this restaurant should be a must on your itinerary. I have never been disappointed!
He had prime rib, I had a petite fillet. Both were cooked perfectly. The sides are al la carte, so we had a salad and baked with it. Very expensive, but the quality was worth it.

Make a reservation well in advance of your trip, you'll be glad you did! If you love red meat you'll love The House of Prime. No extra charge for the side dishes, a great value for a really terrific meal.
You like prime rib? This is the place to get it---with all the traditional trimmings and sides. The "wenches" are happy to serve you with boistrous gusto.
The long aprons on the servers, the shining silver carts that are brought to tableside sheltering a large perfect Prime Rib, the big old wine list. If you want retro, this is the place.
A landmark restaurant in San Francisco! One of those "bucket list" types of places - always busy but great prime rib and awesome horseradish. Friendly service too! Be sure to make reservations...

If you like Prime Rib, this is the place to go. But, you need to make reservations well in advance. Try Open-Table. As a SF native, this is where I take my out-of-town guests for Prime Rib, a great dining experience, and of course, Gus.
I think the steak is good but it's definitely not the best around the area. I like Mortar and Lawry's
This place is the king of prime rib. The food is always more than enough and is fantastic. Excllent dirty martinis at the bar. Reservations are a must.
This is an event restaurant. Fancy without being too pretentious. Their food and waiters are excellent. This place has been around for as long as I can remember (which is a looong time).
This place is like a throwback to Sinatra. Delicious martinis, amazing pieces of meat, creamed spinach, good service. Can't wait to eat here again.
Large portions. Don't be afraid to get the smaller cut, because it is easy to fill up on all the sides.
We throughly enjoyed our meal at the house of Prime Rib. Passed it many times and finally went for supper with my family would definetly go back again
I liked the dessert and the display by the worker making the salad toss. However with the health conscious be ware of the portions. Large meat with the fixins it what it is all about
Had my birthday dinner here and it was delicious! We loved the atmosphere, the wine list and most of all the prime rib. Go hungry because they give you a lot of food. The service is excellent!

column3: Stay off the wonderful side dishes
column4: One of my favorite Prime Rib restaurant of all time. The breads and salads are so good, you can easily forget that you are here for the prime ribs. The portion is huge, matter fact it is all you can eat per order. killer beef
A true San Francisco Institution! Amazing Service, Food & Drinks! Had a 50th Birthday party there and it couldn't have been more perfect!!!! Best Prime Rib on the face of the earth!!!!! Go Hungry:)))
Excellent prime rib! Best I've ever had. The food here is simple and fantastic. The ambiance is old classic and has a great vibe
Hands down the best prime rib EVER!!!! Food is great, service is Awesome, you'll eat till you just can't anymore!! Love this place
Loved this place! Fantastic service, waiter was attentive but not too much, food was excellent. Will definitely go back on our next trip to San Francisco!
This restaurant was fabulous!! The service was wonderful, and the prime rib was to die for. Everything about it was wonderful...would highly recommend it!
Definitely the best prime rib I've ever had If in san francisco I would make trip
This is by far the best place to get Prime Rib anywhere. The food is worth celebrating, but it's a great place for a birthday or anniversary. Splurge a little.
Was there a long time ago but plan to go back. Expensive but a nice treat.
This is is the restaurant to head to if you are looking for fine dining, excellent food and beautiful surroundings. Make reservations, though, otherwise you will have quite a wait.
if you like meat, this is it. they offer a second cut if you finish your first.

column3: A must visit in San Francisco
column4: Excellent food! My fourth trip and plan to visit every time I am there. They have updated the restaurant since my first visit, very stylish and comfortable. Highly recommended.
Great food and service. It's not just a steak house it's a dining experience! I think I could eat there every day!
Excellent meal! Great atmosphere and great service...
Fabulous food, service, location, generous portions, worth every cent.

column3: Dependable excellence and great business destination
column4: The food is excellent, served in a formal but comfortable setting, with excellent service. This is a perfect choice for a business dinner with comfortable seating and moderate sound levels.
Busy place, but worth the wait. Their Prime Rib is exceptional and the experience is one of a kind.
